intro: Thesium nilagiricum, commonly known as Nilagiri thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to the Western Ghats of India, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant features slender, herbaceous stems and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in dense spikes. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Thesium nilagiricum is noted for its ecological significance in its native habitat, supporting local biodiversity.
